about_the_game:
You are the commander of the starship 'Cercopes', a freighter recommissioned as a scientific vessel. An ape designated as Subject 42 is hit by strange cosmic rays during an experiment. Now Subject 42 is faster, stronger and more vicious than any human... and he's out for revenge on your crew!

That's not your only problem... also aboard is an agent from P.E.T.S.S. (Promoting Ethical Treatment of Simians in Space) who will do all they can to hinder your crew and help the rampaging ape. Who among your crew is the traitor? And what do you do with them if you figure it out?

Based on an extraordinary comic book by Joe Assi, Insanium is a tense strategic nightmare with a tongue in its cheek that will be different every game!

* Real time strategy - while you're considering your next move, so is Subject 42!
* Retro Spectrum 48k style visuals.
* A range of weapons and items to help you in the battle... will you use trickery or attempt to defeat Subject 42 in straight combat?
* Secret items can be crafted, it's up to you to work out how.
* Inspired by a comic book and the work of John Heap.
* Four difficulty levels
* No two games will be the same!

content_descriptors.notes: The game is based on a ridiculous comic that features senseless slaughter of characters with no backstory by a killer chimpanzee. The artwork features detailed depictions of brutal murders of the crew. Some of the graphics in the game are taken directly from these images and the comic itself is also included to read within the software.

Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows XP Service Pack 2
  • Processor: Intel Celeron / Athlon Sempron
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Open GL 2.0 compatible
  • Storage: 50 MB available space
  • Sound Card: N/A
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows 7 or better
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 / Athlon FX series or better
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 500 series / ATI Radeon HD 6000 series or better

reviews:
“if you enjoy strategic adventure games, Insanium offers a lot of fun that might be missed if you judge everything by graphics alone.”
Android Police

“A nightmare in the outer reaches of space with graphics and 8-bit retro mechanics in which the tension becomes almost palpable.”
Entertainment Box
short_description: A realtime strategy game with roguelike elements and an old school Spectrum 48k aesthetic. Can your crew overcome the killer ape rampaging aboard their starship?
